Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the bipartisan nature of the legal challenge by stating it is "bipartisan" when only one out of 13 attorneys general supporting the lawsuit is a Democrat.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to be considered bipartisan, as only one out of 13 attorneys general supporting the lawsuit is a Democrat.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the legal challenge can be considered bipartisan based on the support of one Democrat attorney general, despite the overwhelming majority being Republicans.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim could have an alternative explanation that the term "bipartisan" is being used as a political tactic to gain support and create a perception of broader consensus.
